//: Leadworks got purged from mainline, so here is a double barrel Super-Shorty Mini-Shotgun
description: This is a short, light and compact enough double barrel shotgun to be wielded one-handed and used as a "sidearm", with a pair of very small tubular magazines holding only 2 shells each. Curiously, it was part of a crowdfund campaign by die-hard fans of a tactical board game with miniatures set in a grimdark medieval space opera with inquisitors among others using similar but larger bore and gyrojet based "handguns". Like the Inquisition, nobody expected this.

This prototype now snatched from OmniCorp Skunkworks by a survivor is either utterly mad or the ultimate holdout gun. It has one tiny tubular magazine that would be pointless in a shotgun with a conventional action because it can store only one shell. Even more strange it has no trigger, just a safety lever. This is likely the world's first slam fire only shotgun: faster to reload than a normal break action shotgun, with safety off, once a shell is in, the action will shoot it immediately, not even a trigger pull required.

//: Feed system and action inspired by the Gilboa Snake assault rifle. Shared gas port is as long as the barrels in this one, can't be sawn off. Same thing on the two gas ports of the 12-S
description: Perhaps the pinnacle of overkill, OmniCorp Excidia is an automatic double barrel shotgun. Contains two improved chokes, magazines and mirrored ejection ports, but only one trigger: fire modes are set through a selector lever. Its action only supports double shots or full auto. Uses two stacked Saiga-12 or proprietary magazines.

A less overkill, semi automatic version of the Omnicorp Excidia double barrel shotgun minus its built-in accessories and a double trigger instead of a fire selector lever, supporting single shots. Smaller thanks to its telescopic stock, but with greater felt recoil. Uses two stacked Saiga-12 or proprietary magazines.
